  physical_appearance: This is a white kebaya with geometric (checkered) stitching. It has leaf/ foliage interspersed with swirl motifs lining its edges
 sleeves
 and hems. The material is sheer
 and is worn as an open jacket.

  subject_terms_1: womenswear Sino-Japanese War

  subject_terms_3: 1942-1945 Japanese occupation Textile art and design Peranakan costumes

  sgcool_label_text: This white kebaya has a geometric stitching on the body of the cloth
 and an embroidered leaf and swirl pattern around the edges. The kebaya is a loose open jacket usually worn by Peranakan women of the Straits Settlements
 Indonesia and Indo-European women of the late 19th to 20th century It has embroidered edges
 which became popular during the mid-twentieth century and replaced lace as the decoration of choice along the border of the blouses. This kebaya belonged to a Chinese woman who was living in Java during the Japanese Occupation. She took on Peranakan dress and identity to adopt as low a profile  as possible in order not to attract attention

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This white kebaya has a geometric stitching on the body of the cloth, and an embroidered leaf and swirl pattern around the edges. The kebaya is a loose open jacket usually worn by Peranakan women of the Straits Settlements, Indonesia and Indo-European women of the late 19th to 20th century It has embroidered edges, which became popular during the mid-twentieth century and replaced lace as the decoration of choice along the border of the blouses. This kebaya belonged to a Chinese woman who was living in Java during the Japanese Occupation. She took on Peranakan dress and identity to adopt as low a profile  as possible in order not to attract attention
